Operation 'GetContactByIdentifiers' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. The original summary 'Get Contacts by Identifiers' is too generic and doesn't clarify the key differentiator (exact matching). The description, while comprehensive, is verbose and scattered across multiple paragraphs, making it harder for AI agents to quickly understand the operation's purpose and when to use it. The improved summary emphasizes 'exact identifier values' to distinguish this from the Search Contacts endpoint. The improved description consolidates key information into a more structured format: purpose, supported identifier types, use case differentiation, response behaviors, and partial match handling. This makes it clearer for AI agents to determine when this operation is appropriate versus alternatives.

data.current_description:
Use this endpoint to retrieve up to 100 contacts that match the requested identifier values for a single identifier type.

`identifier_type` must be a valid identifier type: `email`, `phone_number_id`, `external_id`, or `anonymous_id`.

Use this endpoint instead of the [Search Contacts endpoint](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/api-reference/contacts/search-contacts) when you can provide exact identifiers and do not need to include other [Segmentation Query Language (SGQL)](https://www.twilio.com/docs/sendgrid/for-developers/sending-email/segmentation-query-language/) filters when searching.

This endpoint returns a `200` status code when any contacts match the identifiers you supplied. When searching multiple identifier values in a single request, it is possible that some will match a contact while others will not. When a partially successful search like this is made, the matching contacts are returned in an object and an error message is returned for the identifier values that are not found.

This endpoint returns a `404` status code when no contacts are found for the provided identifiers.

This endpoint returns a `400` status code if any searched addresses are invalid.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve contacts by exact identifier values
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves up to 100 contacts matching the provided identifier values for a single identifier type. Supports identifier types: `email`, `phone_number_id`, `external_id`, or `anonymous_id`. Use this endpoint for exact identifier matching without additional Segmentation Query Language (SGQL) filters. Returns a `200` status with matching contacts and any non-matching identifier errors in a single response. Returns a `404` status when no contacts match the provided identifiers. Returns a `400` status if any identifier values are invalid. Note: Partial matches are possible when searching multiple identifiersmatching contacts are returned alongside error messages for unmatched identifiers.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Get Contacts by Identifiers' is too generic and doesn't clarify the key differentiator (exact matching). The description, while comprehensive, is verbose and scattered across multiple paragraphs, making it harder for AI agents to quickly understand the operation's purpose and when to use it. The improved summary emphasizes 'exact identifier values' to distinguish this from the Search Contacts endpoint. The improved description consolidates key information into a more structured format: purpose, supported identifier types, use case differentiation, response behaviors, and partial match handling. This makes it clearer for AI agents to determine when this operation is appropriate versus alternatives.

message: Operation 'DeleteContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Delete Contacts' is too generic and doesn't clarify scope. Description lacks clarity on response format (HTTP 202), job tracking capability, and mutual exclusivity of parameters. Enhanced summary specifies 'one or more' and domain context. Enhanced description clarifies both deletion modes, parameter requirements, asynchronous processing, response format, and job tracking for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to delete one or more contacts**.

The query parameter `ids` must set to a comma-separated list of contact IDs for bulk contact deletion.

The query parameter `delete_all_contacts` must be set to `"true"` to delete **all** contacts. 

You must set either `ids` or `delete_all_contacts`.

Deletion jobs are processed asynchronously.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete one or more marketing contacts
data.description_suggestion: Deletes one or more contacts from your marketing database. Supports two deletion modes: delete specific contacts by providing a comma-separated list of contact IDs via the `ids` query parameter, or delete all contacts by setting `delete_all_contacts` to "true". You must specify either `ids` or `delete_all_contacts`, but not both. Deletion is processed asynchronously and returns an HTTP 202 response with a job_id that can be used to track deletion status. Note: Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting contacts regularly as a backup.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Delete Contacts' is too generic and doesn't clarify scope. Description lacks clarity on response format (HTTP 202), job tracking capability, and mutual exclusivity of parameters. Enhanced summary specifies 'one or more' and domain context. Enhanced description clarifies both deletion modes, parameter requirements, asynchronous processing, response format, and job tracking for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'ListContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Get Sample Contacts' is vague and doesn't convey the operation's actual purpose (retrieving recent contacts with count). Description lacks clarity on sorting order, what 'full contact count' represents (total vs. returned), and response format. Enhanced summary clarifies the action and key output. Enhanced description specifies sorting order, clarifies that count is total database count, explains use cases, and includes response format for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint will return up to 50 of the most recent contacts uploaded or attached to a list**. 

This list will then be sorted by email address.

The full contact count is also returned.

Please note that pagination of the contacts has been deprecated.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves up to 50 of the most recently uploaded or modified contacts from your marketing database. Results are sorted by email address in ascending order. The response includes the full contact count across your entire database, not just the returned sample. Note: Pagination has been deprecated for this endpoint. This operation is useful for sampling your contact database or verifying recent contact activity. Returns an HTTP 200 response with contact details and total count.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Get Sample Contacts' is vague and doesn't convey the operation's actual purpose (retrieving recent contacts with count). Description lacks clarity on sorting order, what 'full contact count' represents (total vs. returned), and response format. Enhanced summary clarifies the action and key output. Enhanced description specifies sorting order, clarifies that count is total database count, explains use cases, and includes response format for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'ListBatchedContact' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and appropriate. Description lacks response format (HTTP 200) and behavior for non-existent IDs, which are important for AI agents to understand expected outcomes. Enhanced description adds response format and clarifies handling of invalid IDs to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint is used to retrieve a set of contacts identified by their IDs.**

This can be more efficient endpoint to get contacts than making a series of individual `GET` requests to the "Get a Contact by ID" endpoint.

You can supply up to 100 IDs. Pass them into the `ids` field in your request body as an array or one or more strings.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves multiple contacts in a single request by providing up to 100 contact IDs. Pass contact IDs in the request body `ids` field as an array of strings. This endpoint is more efficient than making multiple individual "Get a Contact by ID" requests. Returns an HTTP 200 response containing the requested contact details. If any provided IDs do not exist, they will be omitted from the response without error.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description lacks response format (HTTP 200) and behavior for non-existent IDs, which are important for AI agents to understand expected outcomes. Enhanced description adds response format and clarifies handling of invalid IDs to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'DeleteContactIdentifier' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and appropriate. Description lacks response format (HTTP 202) and job tracking capability, which are critical for AI agents to understand asynchronous processing. Enhanced description adds response format, job_id tracking, clarifies the constraint about minimum identifiers, and emphasizes distinction from contact deletion for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to delete one identifier from a contact.**

Deletion jobs are processed asynchronously.

Note this is different from deleting a contact. If the contact has only one identifier, the asynchronous request will fail. All contacts are required to have at least one identifier.

The request body field `identifier_type` must have a valid value of "EMAIL", "PHONENUMBERID", "EXTERNALID", or "ANONYMOUSID".
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a single identifier from a specified contact without removing the contact itself. Requires the contact ID in the path and the identifier type in the request body. Valid identifier types are "EMAIL", "PHONENUMBERID", "EXTERNALID", or "ANONYMOUSID". Deletion is processed asynchronously and returns an HTTP 202 response with a job_id for tracking status. Important: The operation will fail if the contact has only one identifier, as all contacts must maintain at least one identifier. This operation is distinct from deleting the entire contact.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description lacks response format (HTTP 202) and job tracking capability, which are critical for AI agents to understand asynchronous processing. Enhanced description adds response format, job_id tracking, clarifies the constraint about minimum identifiers, and emphasizes distinction from contact deletion for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'ExportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Export Contacts' is too generic. Description is verbose and procedural rather than explaining the operation's purpose and effects. Added clarity about asynchronous nature, required inputs (list_ids/segment_ids), output (job id), and side effects (email notification option). Improved AI agent interpretability by clearly stating what the operation does and what to expect.

data.current_description:
**Use this endpoint to export lists or segments of contacts**.

If you would just like to have a link to the exported list sent to your email set the `notifications.email` option to `true` in the `POST` payload.

If you would like to download the list, take the `id` that is returned and use the "Export Contacts Status" endpoint to get the `urls`. Once you have the list of URLs, make a `GET` request to each URL provided to download your CSV file(s).

You specify the segments and or/contact lists you wish to export by providing the relevant IDs in, respectively, the `segment_ids` and `list_ids` fields in the request body.

The lists will be provided in either JSON or CSV files. To specify which of these you would required, set the request body `file_type` field to `json` or `csv`.

You can also specify a maximum file size (in MB). If the export file is larger than this, it will be split into multiple files.
data.summary_suggestion: Initiate asynchronous export of contacts from lists or segments
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous export job for contacts from specified lists and/or segments. Accepts `list_ids` and `segment_ids` to identify which contacts to export. Supports JSON or CSV file formats via the `file_type` parameter. Optionally splits large exports into multiple files by specifying a maximum file size in MB. Returns a job `id` and optional email notification. Use the returned `id` with the "Export Contacts Status" endpoint to retrieve download URLs when the export is ready. Setting `notifications.email` to `true` sends a completion link via email.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Export Contacts' is too generic. Description is verbose and procedural rather than explaining the operation's purpose and effects. Added clarity about asynchronous nature, required inputs (list_ids/segment_ids), output (job id), and side effects (email notification option). Improved AI agent interpretability by clearly stating what the operation does and what to expect.

message: Operation 'ListExportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Get All Existing Exports' is vague about what information is returned. Description is clear but could better emphasize the return structure and use cases. Improved summary to indicate status retrieval. Enhanced description to clarify the array structure, key fields returned, and when URLs become available for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**Use this endpoint to retrieve details of all current exported jobs**.

It will return an array of objects, each of which records an export job in flight or recently completed. 

Each object's `export_type` field will tell you which kind of export it is and its `status` field will indicate what stage of processing it has reached. Exports which are `ready` will be accompanied by a `urls` field which lists the URLs of the export's downloadable files  there will be more than one if you specified a maximum file size in your initial export request.

Use this endpoint if you have exports in flight but do not know their IDs, which are required for the "Export Contacts Status" endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: List all contact export jobs and their statuses
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all contact export jobs, including those in progress and recently completed. Returns an array of export job objects, each containing `export_type`, `status`, and `id` fields. When an export reaches `ready` status, a `urls` field provides download links for the exported file(s). Use this endpoint to discover export job IDs when you don't have them, or to monitor the status of multiple exports. Exports split into multiple files will have multiple URLs in the `urls` field.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get All Existing Exports' is vague about what information is returned. Description is clear but could better emphasize the return structure and use cases. Improved summary to indicate status retrieval. Enhanced description to clarify the array structure, key fields returned, and when URLs become available for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'GetExportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details. Summary 'Export Contacts Status' is vague about the operation's full purpose (retrieving both status AND download URLs). Description lacks clarity about required path parameter and what status values mean. Improved summary to indicate dual purpose. Enhanced description to specify the `id` path parameter requirement, explain status values, and clarify when URLs are available for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to check the status of a contact export job**. 

To use this call, you will need the `id` from the "Export Contacts" call.

If you would like to download a list, take the `id` that is returned from the "Export Contacts" endpoint and make an API request here to get the `urls`. Once you have the list of URLs, make a `GET` request on each URL to download your CSV file(s).

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve status and download URLs for a contact export job
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status and details of a specific contact export job using its `id` (obtained from the "Export Contacts" endpoint). Returns the job's `status` field indicating processing stage (pending, completed, errored, or failed) and a `urls` field containing download links when the export is ready. Use the provided URLs to download the exported contact file(s). Requires the export job `id` as a path parameter.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Export Contacts Status' is vague about the operation's full purpose (retrieving both status AND download URLs). Description lacks clarity about required path parameter and what status values mean. Improved summary to indicate dual purpose. Enhanced description to specify the `id` path parameter requirement, explain status values, and clarify when URLs are available for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'ImportContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary 'Import Contacts' is too generic and doesn't convey the two-step asynchronous nature. Description is procedurally verbose with unnecessary backup recommendation. Improved summary to indicate asynchronous initiation. Restructured description to clearly explain the two-step process, required inputs (file_type, identifiers), optional field_mappings, and output (upload_uri, job_id) for better AI agent understanding of the workflow.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows a CSV upload containing up to one million contacts or 5GB of data, whichever is smaller. At least one identifier is required for a successful import.**

Imports take place asynchronously: the endpoint returns a URL (`upload_uri`) and HTTP headers (`upload_headers`) which can subsequently be used to `PUT` a file of contacts to be imported into our system.

Uploaded CSV files may also be [gzip-compressed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gzip).

In either case, you must include the field `file_type` with the value `csv` in your request body.

The `field_mappings` parameter is a respective list of field definition IDs to map the uploaded CSV columns to. It allows you to use CSVs where one or more columns are skipped (`null`) or remapped to the contact field.

For example, if `field_mappings` is set to `[null, "w1", "_rf1"]`, this means skip column 0, map column 1 to the custom field with the ID `w1`, and map column 2 to the reserved field with the ID `_rf1`. See the "Get All Field Definitions" endpoint to fetch your custom and reserved field IDs to use with `field_mappings`.

Once you receive the response body you can then initiate a **second** API call where you use the supplied URL and HTTP header to upload your file. For example:

`curl --upload-file "file/path.csv" "URL_GIVEN" -H "HEADER_GIVEN"`

If you would like to monitor the status of your import job, use the `job_id` and the "Import Contacts Status" endpoint.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Initiate asynchronous contact import from CSV file
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous two-step contact import process. First, this endpoint returns an `upload_uri` and `upload_headers` for uploading a CSV file (up to 1 million contacts or 5GB, whichever is smaller). Supports gzip-compressed files. Requires `file_type: "csv"` and at least one contact identifier. The optional `field_mappings` parameter maps CSV columns to contact fields, allowing column skipping or remapping. In the second step, use the returned `upload_uri` and headers to PUT your CSV file. Returns a `job_id` for monitoring import progress via the "Import Contacts Status" endpoint. At least one identifier field is required for successful import.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Import Contacts' is too generic and doesn't convey the two-step asynchronous nature. Description is procedurally verbose with unnecessary backup recommendation. Improved summary to indicate asynchronous initiation. Restructured description to clearly explain the two-step process, required inputs (file_type, identifiers), optional field_mappings, and output (upload_uri, job_id) for better AI agent understanding of the workflow.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to check the status of a contact import job**. 

Use the `job_id` from the "Import Contacts," "Add or Update a Contact," or "Delete Contacts" endpoints as the `id` in the path parameter.

If there is an error with your `PUT` request, download the `errors_url` file and open it to view more details.

The job `status` field indicates whether the job is `pending`, `completed`, `errored`, or `failed`. 

Pending means not started. Completed means finished without any errors. Errored means finished with some errors. Failed means finished with all errors, or the job was entirely unprocessable: for example, if you attempt to import file format we do not support.

The `results` object will have fields depending on the job type.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve status and results of a contact import job
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current status and results of a contact import job using its `job_id` (obtained from the "Import Contacts", "Add or Update a Contact", or "Delete Contacts" endpoints). Returns the job's `status` field with values: `pending` (not started), `completed` (finished without errors), `errored` (finished with some errors), or `failed` (finished with all errors or unprocessable file). When errors occur, an `errors_url` field provides a downloadable file with error details. The `results` object contains job-specific outcome information. Use this endpoint to monitor import progress and diagnose issues.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Import Contacts Status' is vague about what information is returned beyond status. Description is clear but includes unnecessary backup recommendation and could better organize status value explanations. Improved summary to indicate results retrieval. Reorganized description to clearly present status values with meanings, error handling via errors_url, and results object for better AI agent decision-making about when to use this endpoint.

message: Operation 'SearchContact' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Summary 'Search Contacts' is too generic and doesn't mention SGQL. Description lacks context about result limits and when to use alternatives. Added SGQL reference to summary. Enhanced description to clarify 50-contact limit, email case handling, timestamp format, timeout behavior, and guidance on when to use alternative endpoints for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**Use this endpoint to locate contacts**.

The request body's `query` field accepts valid [SGQL](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/segmentation-query-language/) for searching for a contact.

Because contact emails are stored in lower case, using SGQL to search by email address requires the provided email address to be in lower case. The SGQL `lower()` function can be used for this.

Only the first 50 contacts that meet the search criteria will be returned.

If the query takes longer than 20 seconds, a `408 Request Timeout` status will be returned.

Formatting the `created_at` and `updated_at` values as Unix timestamps is deprecated. Instead, they are returned as ISO format as string.
data.summary_suggestion: Search contacts using Segmentation Query Language (SGQL)
data.description_suggestion: Searches for contacts using Segmentation Query Language (SGQL) queries provided in the request body's `query` field. Returns up to 50 matching contacts. Email searches require lowercase addresses; use the SGQL `lower()` function to normalize email input. Timestamps in results are returned as ISO 8601 formatted strings (Unix timestamp format is deprecated). Queries exceeding 20 seconds return a `408 Request Timeout` status. Use this endpoint for complex contact searches with multiple filter criteria; for exact email lookups, consider the "Get Contacts by Emails" endpoint instead.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Search Contacts' is too generic and doesn't mention SGQL. Description lacks context about result limits and when to use alternatives. Added SGQL reference to summary. Enhanced description to clarify 50-contact limit, email case handling, timestamp format, timeout behavior, and guidance on when to use alternative endpoints for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'ListContactByEmail' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary 'Get Contacts by Emails' is vague about the exact match nature and result limits. Description is verbose with unnecessary backup recommendation and unclear about response structure for partial matches. Improved summary to emphasize exact matching. Restructured description to clearly explain search scope (primary and alternate emails), case handling, result limits, HTTP status codes for different scenarios, and when to use this endpoint versus alternatives for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve up to 100 contacts matching the searched `email` address(es), including any `alternate_emails`.** 

Email addresses are unique to a contact, meaning this endpoint can treat an email address as a primary key to search by. The contact object associated with the address, whether it is their `email` or one of their `alternate_emails` will be returned if matched.

Email addresses in the search request do not need to match the case in which they're stored, but the email addresses in the result will be all lower case. Empty strings are excluded from the search and will not be returned.

This endpoint should be used in place of the "Search Contacts" endpoint when you can provide exact email addresses and do not need to include other [Segmentation Query Language (SGQL)](https://sendgrid.com/docs/for-developers/sending-email/segmentation-query-language/) filters when searching.

If you need to access a large percentage of your contacts, we recommend exporting your contacts with the "Export Contacts" endpoint and filtering the client side results.

This endpoint returns a `200` status code when any contacts match the address(es) you supplied. When searching multiple addresses in a single request, it is possible that some addresses will match a contact while others will not. When a partially successful search like this is made, the matching contacts are returned in an object and an error message is returned for the email address(es) that are not found. 

This endpoint returns a `404` status code when no contacts are found for the provided email address(es).

A `400` status code is returned if any searched addresses are invalid.

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your contacts regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve contacts by exact email address match
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves up to 100 contacts matching the provided email address(es), searching both primary `email` and `alternate_emails` fields. Email addresses are case-insensitive in requests but returned in lowercase. Returns `200` with matching contacts when any addresses match; partial matches return both matching contacts and error messages for unmatched addresses. Returns `404` when no contacts are found for any provided addresses. Returns `400` if any email addresses are invalid. Empty strings are excluded from searches. Prefer this endpoint over "Search Contacts" for exact email lookups without additional SGQL filters.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get Contacts by Emails' is vague about the exact match nature and result limits. Description is verbose with unnecessary backup recommendation and unclear about response structure for partial matches. Improved summary to emphasize exact matching. Restructured description to clearly explain search scope (primary and alternate emails), case handling, result limits, HTTP status codes for different scenarios, and when to use this endpoint versus alternatives for better AI agent decision-making.
